title: STEM Ecosystem Design and Interaction Analysis-Based Pedagogical Development for Secondary Science Teachers

context.prior_knowledge: Secondary education curriculum knowledge and science subject teaching experience (3+ years)
context.additional_context: Non-degree professional training program conducted in a constrained technology environment centered on smartphones.

learning_goals: Learners design and evaluate three or more STEM ecosystem models using design-based research (DBR) methodology.
Learners develop five or more linkage strategies between classroom and external learning environments using interaction analysis techniques.
Learners create personalized activity plans for STEM identity formation and conduct peer feedback sessions.
Design and implementation of project-based instruction utilizing internal and external school resources (libraries, businesses, local communities)
Preparation of a report to improve STEM ecosystem design based on formative assessment data

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
